excerpt: Arima Onsen is an onsen, or hot springs in Kita-ku, Kobe, Japan, located near Mount Rokkō. This onsen attracts many Japanese because of its easy access from the busy cities in the Kansai metropolitan area including Osaka and Kobe. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Arima Onsen, located in Kita-ku, Kobe, Japan, is a hidden gem nestled behind Mount Rokkō. This ancient hot spring bathing resort has a history dating back over a thousand years and is known for its tranquil natural surroundings. The onsen's health-giving waters have been enjoyed by locals and visitors for centuries. The famous Kin-no-Yu (Golden Bath) and Gin-no-Yu (Silver Bath) are rich in minerals and offer therapeutic benefits.
name: Arima Onsen
address: Arimacho, Kita Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 651-1401, Japan

excerpt: Big botanical garden with themed areas growing many flowers & herbs, plus restaurants & a gift shop.
detail_description: Kobe Nunobiki Herb Gardens is a large botanical garden located on the hill of the mountain, accessible by hiking or cable car. It offers themed areas with a variety of flowers and herbs in full bloom, along with restaurants and a gift shop. Visitors can enjoy picturesque views of Kobe from this popular spot, which also features a small museum showcasing how herbs and flowers are used to create scents.
name: Kobe Nunobiki Herb Gardens & Ropeway
address: 1 Chome-4-3 Kitanocho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0002, Japan

excerpt: Cable cars access this mountain peak offering an observation deck & restaurants with sweeping views.
detail_description: Mount Rokkō, also known as Rokko-san, is a prominent attraction in Kobe, Japan. It is part of the large mountain range that includes Mt. Rokko and offers stunning views of the surrounding area. Visitors can access the peak via cable cars and enjoy an observation deck with panoramic vistas. The area is also famous for its night views, considered one of Japan's three famous night views.
name: Mount Rokkō
address: Arimacho, Kita Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 651-1401, Japan

excerpt: Decorative tower reaching 108m & featuring an observation deck with panoramic city views.
detail_description: Kobe Port Tower is a prominent landmark in the city, standing at 108 meters tall and offering an observation deck with stunning panoramic views of Kobe. The tower's unique design, constructed with a complex network of pipes, has made it a national symbol. Visitors can enjoy bird's-eye views of the city from its five floors during the day and witness the spectacular display of 7,040 LED lights illuminating the tower at night. It is considered a must-see attraction for anyone visiting Kobe.
name: Kobe Port Tower
address: 5-5 Hatobacho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0042, Japan

excerpt: Established in 1868, this Chinese cultural district offers eateries, souvenir shops & mahjong clubs.
detail_description: Kobe Chinatown, also known as Nankin-machi, is a vibrant cultural district in Kobe that dates back to 1868 when Chinese merchants settled there after the port was opened for foreign trade. This area features two main streets and a central plaza filled with Chinese restaurants, street food stalls, souvenir shops, and mahjong clubs. Visitors can indulge in a variety of Chinese cuisines such as steamed buns, Szechuan noodles, dim sum, and Chinese ramen.
name: Kobe Chinatown Nankin-machi
address: 1 Chome-3-18 Sakaemachidori, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0023, Japan

excerpt: Waterside commercial & entertainment area in an old train station with shopping, hotels & dining.
detail_description: Kobe Harborland is a vibrant waterfront commercial and entertainment district located just a short walk from Meriken Park and Kobe Station. This area was redeveloped after the 1995 earthquake and now features a mix of shopping areas, including Mosaic, South Mall, and North Mall, with department stores, boutique shops, and numerous dining options.
name: Kobe Harborland
address: 1 Chome Higashikawasakicho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0044, Japan

excerpt: Urban waterfront park featuring an observation tower, an earthquake memorial & a maritime museum.
detail_description: Meriken Park is a popular urban waterfront park in Kobe, known for its observation tower, earthquake memorial, and maritime museum. The park overlooks Kobe Port and offers a romantic evening atmosphere with impressive illumination at night. Located near Kobe Harborland, the area was redesigned after the 1995 earthquake and now features art installations and modern architecture. Visitors can enjoy the sea breeze, beautiful scenery, as well as attractions like Hotel Okura Kobe and a movie theater.
name: TIMES Meriken Park
address: 2 Hatobacho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0042, Japan

excerpt: One of the world's longest suspension bridges, with tours to the top & to its exhibition center.
detail_description: The Akashi-Kaikyo Bridge is a remarkable suspension bridge that connects Kobe City and Awaji Island, spanning the scenic Akashi Strait. It holds the distinction of being one of the world's longest suspension bridges, offering tours to its exhibition center and top. Opened in 1998, it was once the longest suspension bridge globally at 3,911m.
name: Akashi-Kaikyo Bridge
address: 4 Higashimaikocho, Tarumi-ku, Kobe, Hyogo 655-0047, Japan

excerpt: Commemorating the devastating 1995 earthquake, this waterfront memorial displays preserved damage.
detail_description: Port of Kobe Earthquake Memorial Park is a waterfront site that serves as a tribute to the catastrophic 1995 earthquake. The Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake Memorial Museum, located within the park, offers an educational experience about the earthquake's impact on Kobe. It features a documentary showcasing the devastation and subsequent rebuilding efforts. The museum also houses displays and resources related to earthquakes and disaster prevention. The park itself provides a serene setting for reflection, with preserved damage from the earthquake on display.
name: Port of Kobe Earthquake Memorial Park
address: 2 Hatobacho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0042, Japan

excerpt: Peaceful Japanese gardens with diverse blooms & walking paths amid waterfalls & ponds.
detail_description: Sorakuen Garden is a serene Japanese garden located just 10 minutes from Motomachi Station in Kobe. It features diverse blooms, tranquil walking paths, waterfalls, and ponds. This traditional garden was completed in the 20th century as part of the former residence of a major of Kobe and showcases nihon teien (Japanese garden) design.
name: Sorakuen Garden
address: 5 Chome-3-1 Nakayamatedori, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0004, Japan

excerpt: Kobe is a city on Osaka Bay in central Japan. It is known for its signature marbled beef and scenic setting of mountains framing the harbor. The Ikuta Shrine, dating to the 3rd century, is among Japan's oldest Shinto shrines. Antique cable cars connect Kobe to Mt. Rokko, which offers panoramic views over the port. Beyond the Mount Rokko hills are the outdoor hot springs of Arima Onsen.
detail_description: Kobe, a city in central Japan, is famous for its marbled beef and picturesque setting with mountains surrounding the harbor. It boasts historic sites like the Ikuta Shrine and offers panoramic views from Mt. Rokko accessible by antique cable cars. The city's rich history as a port includes being one of the first to open to foreign trade and hosting one of Japan's big Chinatowns.
name: Kobe
address: Hyogo, Japan

excerpt: Museum showcasing mostly contemporary Japanese & Western art, plus 19th-century European sculpture.
detail_description: Located about 4km northwest of Meriken Park in the HAT Kobe District, Hyogo Prefectural Museum of Art is a modern museum designed by renowned architect Tadao Ando. It features an extensive collection of contemporary Japanese and Western art, as well as 19th-century European sculpture.
name: Hyogo Prefectural Museum of Art
address: 1 Chome-1-1 Wakinohamakaigandori, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 651-0073, Japan

excerpt: Small area at the base of a mountain range with a variety of mansions exhibiting outside influences.
detail_description: Kitanocho, a historic neighborhood nestled at the foot of a mountain range, boasts an array of well-preserved mansions showcasing diverse external influences. The area's enchanting nighttime skyline resembles the waterfront at Kobe's Port Tower, with cruise ships moored at the pier and the illuminated Yokohama Marine Tower. Kitanocho and Yokohama's Yamate area both retain numerous sites reflecting their history as primary residential districts for Westerners.
name: Kitanocho
address: Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0002, Japan

excerpt: Greenhouse-based park featuring tropical plants, birds & small mammals, plus interactive shows.
detail_description: Kobe Animal Kingdom, located in the picturesque Kitano area of Kobe, is a unique and unexpected attraction. This greenhouse-based park is home to a variety of tropical plants, birds, and small mammals. Visitors can enjoy interactive shows and get up close with animals like capybaras, sloths, alpacas, kangaroos, rabbits, and more. The park offers ample space for creatures to roam in environments mimicking their natural habitats.
name: Kobe Animal Kingdom
address: 7 Chome-1-9 Minatojima Minamimachi, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0047, Japan

excerpt: Exhibits on the past, present & future of the sea, ships & local ports are featured at this museum.
detail_description: The Kobe Maritime Museum, located in the Meriken Park, is a celebration of the rich maritime history of the Port of Kobe. Established to commemorate the 120th anniversary of the port's opening, this museum offers visitors a journey through time with exhibits showcasing the past, present, and future of sea travel and local ports. The museum features ship records, diorama models, and interactive displays that provide insight into the evolution of the port from its early days to its current operations.
name: Kobe Maritime Museum
address: 2-2 Hatobacho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0042, Japan

excerpt: Time-tested zoo featuring unique animals & a small amusement park with rides for children.
detail_description: Kobe Ōji Zoo, located just a few train stations away from central Kobe-Sannomiya Station, is a well-established zoo with over 850 animals and birds from 150 different species. Visitors can see rare animals such as the giant panda, golden snub-nosed monkey, Amur tiger, polar bear, and snow leopard. The zoo also features an amusement park with rides for children and a zoological science museum.
name: Kobe Ōji Zoo
address: 3 Chome-1 Ojicho, Nada Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 657-0838, Japan

excerpt: Historical, Western-style homes built by foreign merchants & diplomats dot this scenic hill.
detail_description: Kitano Ijinkan-Gai is a picturesque hill area in Kobe, featuring historical Western-style homes built by foreign merchants and diplomats. This residential area was developed alongside the opening of Kobe's port in 1868 and includes 30 well-preserved western-style buildings, with 16 open for interior tours.
name: Kitano Ijinkan-Gai
address: Kitanocho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0002, Japan

excerpt: Historic sake brewery with displays illuminating the fermentation process & samples of the spirit.
detail_description: The Hakutsuru Sake Brewery Museum, located in Kobe's Nada district, offers a fascinating glimpse into the traditional art of sake production. Housed in a historic brewery dating back to 1743, this museum provides English-language exhibits and informative videos that detail the fermentation process. Visitors can enjoy complimentary tastings of freshly brewed sake while learning about the region's rich sake-making heritage.
name: Hakutsuru Sake Brewery Museum
address: 4 Chome-5-5 Sumiyoshi Minamimachi, Higashinada Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 658-0041, Japan

excerpt: Mountain falls accessed via hiking trail, with panoramic skyline & harbor views from nearby ridges.
detail_description: Nunobiki Falls, located on the slopes of Mount Rokko in Kobe, is a serene natural attraction featuring two beautiful waterfalls known as Ontaki and Meotodaki. These falls have been admired for their scenic beauty and spiritual significance for centuries. Accessible from Shin-Kobe Station, visitors can enjoy a tranquil retreat surrounded by lush greenery and picturesque hiking trails.
name: Nunobiki Falls (Ontaki / Meotodaki)
address: Fukiaicho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 651-0058, Japan

excerpt: Neoclassical buiding housing archeological artifacts, art & documents related to the city of Kobe.
detail_description: The Kobe City Museum, housed in a former 1930s bank, is a neoclassical building that showcases archaeological artifacts, art, and documents related to the city of Kobe. It opened in 1982 and features around 70,000 cultural artifacts significant to the local area. The museum's specialty is Namban art from the 16th and 17th centuries, heavily influenced by the arrival of European merchants to Japan.
name: Kobe City Museum
address: 24 Kyomachi, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0034, Japan

excerpt: Scenic, aerial cable car passing by the Nunobiki Waterfall & Nunobiki Herb Garden.
detail_description: Experience the breathtaking views of Kobe and its surroundings with a ride on the Kobe Nunobiki Ropeway. Departing from Shin-Kobe station, this aerial cable car takes you on a comfortable journey to notable attractions such as Nunobiki Waterfall, Nunobiki Herb Garden, and an observation deck offering stunning vistas of the city and sea. As you ascend Mount Rokko, marvel at the natural beauty and enjoy panoramic scenes.
name: Kobe Nunobiki Ropeway
address: Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

excerpt: Landscaped garden park at high altitude offering scenic panoramas, shopping, dining & a tea room.
detail_description: Rokko Garden Terrace is a picturesque garden park located at a high altitude, offering stunning panoramic views, shopping opportunities, dining options, and a charming tea room. Visitors can enjoy the breathtaking scenery from Kikuseidai, a mountaintop park on Mt. Maya with views of the bay and Kobe City's renowned night view. The Rokko Shidare Observatory adds to the enchanting atmosphere with its illuminated displays that change with the seasons.
name: Rokko Garden Terrace
address: Gosukeyama-1877-9 Rokkosancho, Nada Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 657-0101, Japan

excerpt: Sprawling amusement park with flower gardens, seasonal U-pick fruit & a range of restaurants.
detail_description: Kobe Fruit Flower Park Osawa Rest Area is a sprawling amusement park located on the outskirts of Kobe. It features beautiful flower gardens, seasonal U-pick fruit, and a variety of restaurants. The park is part of a family-friendly complex that includes a hotel and an amusement park, making it an ideal destination for visitors of all ages. One of the highlights is trying the famous Kobe beef, known for its marbling and juiciness.
name: Kobe Fruit Flower Park Ozo Rest Area
address: Kamiozo-2150 Ozocho, Kita Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 651-1522, Japan

excerpt: Sleek, contemporary structure with tool displays, building models & workshops, plus a garden.
detail_description: The Takenaka Carpentry Tools Museum, located near Shin-Kobe station, offers a captivating exploration of Japanese architecture and woodworking. Visitors can immerse themselves in the history, traditions, and artistry of traditional Japanese carpentry through sleek displays of tools, building models, and workshops. The museum showcases the unique joinery techniques that create elaborate temples and houses without nails or screws.
name: Takenaka Carpentry Tools Museum
address: 7 Chome-5-1 Kumochicho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 651-0056, Japan

excerpt: Institution dedicated to earthquake risk management & education, featuring a memorial museum.
detail_description: The Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake Memorial Disaster Reduction and Human Renovation Institution is a museum dedicated to earthquake risk management and education. It features a memorial museum that details the 1995 Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake, which caused significant devastation in Kobe. The museum aims to educate visitors about the earthquake through immersive re-creations using projection screens, special effects, and soundscapes.
name: The Great Hanshin-Awaji Earthquake Memorial Disaster Reduction and Human Renovation Institution
address: 1 Chome-5-2 Wakinohamakaigandori, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 651-0073, Japan

excerpt: Sannomiya is a lively retail area with department stores along Center-gai Shopping Street and around Sannomiya Station. An underground shopping area with restaurants draws commuters to sushi bars and Kobe beef eateries. Brightly lit high-rises are packed with small pubs and music clubs. Sanseido Gallery showcases modern Japanese art, while the Flower Clock, made of planted blooms, is a popular meeting spot.
detail_description: Sannomiya, located in Kobe, is a bustling retail district known for its department stores and vibrant Center-gai Shopping Street. The area around Sannomiya Station offers an underground shopping area with a variety of restaurants, including sushi bars and Kobe beef eateries. The district is also home to brightly lit high-rises housing small pubs and music clubs.
name: Sannomiya
address: 3 Chome-9 Sannomiyacho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

detail_description: Kobe beef Hana-Houbi is a must-try when visiting Kobe. The experience of having a skilled chef cook the beef right in front of you adds to the allure. The set course meal includes a delightful seafood salad, perfectly cooked Kobe Beef sourced locally, and a beautifully presented dessert with fresh fruit. The restaurant also offers excellent wine pairing recommendations.
name: Kobe beef Hana-Houbi
address: TN-Ⅱビル 2F, 2 Chome-11-30 Shimoyamatedori, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0011, Japan

excerpt: Mountain with an elevation of 698 meters & a scenic summit accessible by aerial tram & cable car.
detail_description: Mount Maya, with an elevation of 698 meters, is a picturesque peak accessible by aerial tram and cable car. It offers a stunning nighttime view of Kobe, which has been recognized as one of Japan's top three best night views. The Kikuseidai viewing area provides breathtaking vistas of the city lights stretching from Kobe to Osaka. This romantic and easily accessible destination in the Rokko Mountains is perfect for enjoying the beauty of nature and the glittering night scenery.
name: Mount Maya
address: Mayasan, Nada Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 657-0104, Japan

excerpt: Vibrant covered passageway between buildings offering diverse retail stores & many restaurants.
detail_description: Sannomiya Center Gai Shopping Street is a vibrant covered passageway in downtown Kobe, conveniently located near various attractions. This commercial complex houses the popular Sannomiya Centre Street underground shopping market, featuring 120 establishments offering upscale fashion, books, electronics, and eateries. Divided into three streets, it hosts a wide array of shops from well-known Japanese retailers to unique Kobe goods stores.
name: Sannomiya Center Gai Shopping Street
address: Japan, 〒650-0021 Hyogo, Kobe, Chuo Ward, Sannomiyacho, 1 Chome, ～３丁目

excerpt: Spacious, serene arboretum & garden with a wide variety of trees, shrubs & flowers in bloom.
detail_description: The Kobe Municipal Arboretum, also known as the Kobe City Forest Botanical Garden, is a vast and tranquil space located near Mt. Maya. It offers a diverse collection of trees, shrubs, and blooming flowers throughout the year. Spanning 142.6 hectares, this botanical garden features over 1,200 plant species arranged in different zones based on their places of origin.
name: Kobe Municipal Arboretum
address: Japan, 〒651-1102 Hyogo, Kobe, Kita Ward, Yamadacho Kamitanigami, 字長尾1-2

detail_description: If you're a food enthusiast or simply enjoy indulging in exquisite cuisine, then experiencing Kobe beef should be on your travel itinerary. Renowned worldwide, Kobe beef is a type of wagyu beef known for its marbling and tenderness. It originates from purebred black Japanese cattle of the Tajima breed and must meet strict criteria to earn the label of Kobe beef. While it's associated with the city of Kobe, these cattle are actually raised in Hyogo Prefecture.
name: Kobe Beef Steak Restaurant Royal Mouriya
address: 第１岸ビル 2F, 1 Chome-9-9 Kitanagasadori, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0012, Japan

detail_description: Shin-Kobe Station offers a thrilling experience with the Shin-Kobe Ropeway, which takes visitors on a scenic journey above the treetops to an observation deck boasting stunning views of the urban landscape and even extending to the Seto Inland Sea on clear days. After taking in the panorama, visitors can explore further by embarking on a mountain hike or strolling through the Nunobiki Herb Gardens, showcasing seasonal flora.
name: Shin-Kobe Station
address: 1 Chome-3-1 Kanocho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

detail_description: Experience the beauty of Kobe from a different perspective with a Kobe Bay Cruise. Lasting about 40 minutes, these cruises depart hourly from Meriken Park beside the red Port Tower. Enjoy a relaxing sail around the bustling port city, taking in stunning views of the city and sea. The friendly crew offers cold drinks onboard, making it a perfect way to unwind after exploring Harborland's shopping and dining options.
name: Kobe Bay Cruise
address: Kamomeria Bus Stop, 7-1 Hatobacho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0042, Japan

detail_description: Former Kobe Foreign Settlement is a historic area in Kobe that was once designated as a residential area for foreign traders when the port opened in 1868. The town features impressive western architecture and modern buildings, offering visitors a glimpse of European style within Japan. A stone monument near Daimaru Kobe store commemorates the 100th anniversary of the port's opening and the existence of the settlement until around 1899.
name: Former Kobe Foreign Settlement
address: Nishimachi, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0038, Japan

excerpt: Admission is free to this 24th-floor observation room for city views & local-information displays.
detail_description: The Kobe City Hall Observation Lobby, located on the 24th floor near Sannomiya Station, offers a free and convenient way to enjoy panoramic views of Kobe. From this vantage point, visitors can take in stunning vistas of Kobe Port, surrounding mountains including Mt. Rokko, Port Island, Meriken Park, and Kitano-cho. While enjoying the view from the observation deck facing Flower Road, guests can also visit the cafe and restaurant on the same floor for refreshments.
name: Kobe City Hall Observation Lobby
address: 6 Chome-5-1 Kanocho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0001, Japan

detail_description: The Rokko Cable Line is a historic Japanese funicular that has been in operation since 1932, offering visitors a scenic journey to the top of Mt. Rokko. Departing from the Rokko Cable Shita station at the mountain's base, it takes approximately 10 minutes to reach the Rokko Sanjo station at the summit.
name: Rokko Cable Line
address: Nada Ward, Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

excerpt: Founded in the early 3rd century, this prominent, traditional Shinto shrine is among Japan's oldest.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant Sannomiya district of Kobe, Ikuta Jinja stands as a testament to Japan's rich cultural heritage, having been established in the early 3rd century by Empress Jingu. This revered Shinto shrine is dedicated to Wakahirume-no-Mikoto, the goddess of weaving, and serves as a serene escape from the lively streets nearby.
name: Ikuta Jinja
address: 1 Chome-2-1 Shimoyamatedori, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0011, Japan

excerpt: Modern harborfront shopping mall on 3 levels, with international brands, food outlets & free Wi-Fi.
detail_description: Umie is a modern shopping complex located in Kobe Harborland, offering three levels of retail therapy with international brands, dining options, and complimentary Wi-Fi. The expansive area provides direct access to the ocean and is a popular destination for tourists looking to shop, dine, and enjoy leisurely strolls. Divided into North Mall, South Mall, and Mosaic Mall, it also features a movie theater. At night, the area transforms into a stunning sight with its picturesque views.
name: umie
address: 1 Chome-7-2 Higashikawasakicho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0044, Japan

excerpt: Modern shopping center featuring international outlet stores offering brand-name items.
detail_description: Kobe Sanda Premium Outlets is a modern shopping center located in Kobe, Japan, designed after the exclusive residential area of Pasadena near Los Angeles. It's the second largest outlet mall in Japan and houses around 210 high-end brand shops from both Japanese and international retailers. The outlets offer a wide range of stores including famous foreign brands like GUCCI and PRADA, as well as domestic brands such as UNITED ARROWS and BEAMS.
name: Kobe Sanda Premium Outlets
address: 7-3 Kozudai, Kita Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 651-1515, Japan

excerpt: Arena for soccer & rugby with a retractable dome roof, plus an adjoining park popular for pregaming.
detail_description: Noevir Stadium Kobe, also known as Kobe Misaki Stadium, is a versatile arena in Kobe that hosts soccer and rugby events. With its retractable dome roof and a capacity of 30,000 people, it's home to the Kobelco Steelers rugby team. The stadium offers a great atmosphere for live sporting events and is popular for pregame activities in the adjoining park. Visitors can enjoy easy access, good views from upper levels, and the option to bring their own food and drinks.
name: Noevir Stadium Kobe
address: 1 Chome-2-2 Misakicho, Hyogo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 652-0855, Japan

excerpt: Tastings & displays on sake making in a brewery dating to 1659, rebuilt in 1999 after an earthquake.
detail_description: The Kiku-Masamune Sake Brewery Museum is a must-visit destination in Kobe, Japan. Established in 1659 and rebuilt after an earthquake in 1999, this brewery offers tastings and exhibits showcasing the art of sake making. The museum provides insights into the origins of sake brewing, the traditional tools used, and the process itself. Visitors can enjoy a free tour that includes witnessing masters crafting barrels and culminates with a delightful sake tasting experience.
name: Kiku-Masamune Sake Brewery Museum
address: 1 Chome-9-1 Uozaki Nishimachi, Higashinada Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 658-0026, Japan

detail_description: The Kobe Anpanman Children’s Museum & Mall is a vibrant and interactive destination in Kobe, inspired by the beloved Anpanman franchise. It offers a plethora of activities for kids, including games, toys, and exhibits. The museum also features shopping facilities and various leisure options such as the Kobe Concerto and Mosaic Big Ferris Wheel. Visitors with children who are fans of Anpanman will find this place to be a must-visit, as it offers an immersive experience with the characters.
name: Kōbe Anpanman Children’s Museum & Mall
address: 1 Chome-6-2 Higashikawasakicho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0044, Japan

detail_description: The Mosaic Big Ferris Wheel is a must-visit attraction located at the Mosaic shopping mall in Kobe. Offering a breathtaking 360-degree view of the city, this giant Ferris wheel provides an unforgettable experience for visitors. While it may not be as massive as some other Ferris wheels, such as the Cosmo Clock 21 in Yokohama, it still offers stunning views and is definitely worth a visit.
name: Mosaic Big Ferris Wheel
address: 1 Chome-6-1 Higashikawasakicho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0044, Japan

excerpt: Mountain falls accessed via hiking trail, with panoramic skyline & harbor views from nearby ridges.
detail_description: Nunobiki Falls - Ontaki is renowned as one of the Three Greatest Divine Waterfalls in Japan and is also listed among the Top 100 Waterfalls in the country. Surprisingly, this famous waterfall is just a short 10 to 15-minute hike away from Shin-Kobe Station. The trail, lined with trees and commemorative poems carved into boulders, offers a pleasant walk leading to several falls along the way.
name: Nunobiki Falls (Ontaki / Meotodaki)
address: Fukiaicho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 651-0058, Japan

detail_description: Ascend to the peak of Mount Rokko by taking a ride on the Rokko Arima Ropeway from Arima Onsen. The breathtaking aerial tramway offers stunning vistas of Kobe and Osaka. Once at the top, immerse yourself in the Alpine Rokko Botanical Garden, explore the animal activities at Rokko Pastures, and unwind at Rokko Garden Terrace. The 1.
name: Rokko Arima Ropeway
address: Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

detail_description: Daimaru Kobe is a retail complex situated in the charming streets of the former foreign residences. It offers a variety of luxury brands, trendy stores, and select shops for shoppers of all ages. The area is also home to boutique shops like Former Foreign Settlement 38-bankan, which retains its historical charm. Additionally, the B1 floor is a paradise for those with a sweet tooth as it houses numerous famous cake and pastry stores such as Motomachi Cake and Juchheim.
name: Daimaru Kobe
address: 40 Akashimachi, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0037, Japan

excerpt: A functional & naturally rich man-made island completed under Kobe City's maritime city plan.
detail_description: Rokkō Island is a man-made island developed as part of Kobe City's maritime city plan. It took nearly 20 years to build and has become a bustling residential, tourist, and commercial district since its opening in 1992. The island offers various attractions such as water amusement parks, sports facilities, jogging paths, restaurants, movie theaters, and museums. Additionally, Rokko Meets Art -Art Walk- hosts art exhibitions and workshops for visitors to enjoy.
name: Rokkō Island
address: Higashinada Ward, Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

excerpt: Intimate live jazz bar with a grand piano, guitars on the walls & regular jam sessions.
detail_description: Basin Street is an intimate live jazz bar in Kobe, known for its cozy atmosphere and talented musicians. The venue features a grand piano, guitars adorning the walls, and regular jam sessions. Every October, the city hosts the Kobe Jazz Street event, which includes a lively jazz parade and festive decorations across various venues.
name: Basin Street [ベイズンストリートJazz Live Bar]
address: 1 Chome-22-13 Nakayamatedori, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0004, Japan

detail_description: Kitano St, located north of Sannomiya downtown in Kobe, is a multicultural area with a significant foreign presence. The streets are adorned with European-style homes from the early 20th century, creating an ambiance that transports visitors to another place and time. Many of these historic buildings have been repurposed into trendy cafes and restaurants, adding to the area's allure.
name: Kitano
address: Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo, Japan

excerpt: This museum hosts changing art exhibits in a 19th-century building that once held the US consulate.
detail_description: Kobe Kitano Museum, housed in a 19th-century building that once served as the US consulate, showcases rotating art exhibitions. The museum features artworks depicting the history and culture of Kitano Ijinkan-gai and masterpieces from artists of Paris' Montmartre district. This historic structure is part of a collection of well-preserved Western buildings in the area. Visitors can admire the classic French-style architecture while enjoying a leisurely cultural experience through art.
name: Kobe Kitano Museum
address: 2 Chome-9-6 Kitanocho, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyogo 650-0002, Japan
